title: Ezreal's Arcane Shift Target Priority
body: After seeing the recent AD ratio added to Ezreal's Arcane Shift (E), I've been concerned with it's homing mechanic. Unlike abilities such as Ahri's Fox Fire (W) & Spirit Rush (R), it does not prioritize champions over minions & monsters. Is there any intended reason this has never been implemented?

replies.body: I don't necessarily know the exact reason, but I'd assume it's because the counterplay for the spell is better if opponents can position such that they can expect to not be hit. To use your example above, I'd say we should make Ahri's W and R act more like Ezreal's E than the other way around.

It's to prevent AP Ezreal from being stinking ridiculously OP. Seriously, if Riot made his E prioritize enemy champions and *didn't* hit it's AP ratio, the added burst and safety would be off the charts.

It's about mechanical consistency though. Automatic projectiles should always prioritize for enemy champions because that's what makes sense in the majority of scenarios where you'd want to use a skill. It's awkward as a League player to go from one character to another with similar abilities (Ahri, Ezrael) and having them not function the same way. For example, cone abilities were all changed to stay attached to their characters when not smart-casting; because it was super wonky to have Talon, Kassadin, and Cho all have similar abilities that were mechanically different on use.
